content: simple kobo libra cover this e-reader cosy is designed to fit the kobo libra and is worked to a standard dk-weight gauge of 22 stitches and 28 row per 4 inches or 10cm gauge is a guideline but not critical the cosy has about an inch of negative ease so that it holds your device snugly but it s not the end of the world if it s not bang-on gauge you will need a total of approx 25g of yarn or 50-60m the contrast colour can be a small scrap of whatever you have left either dk or fingering weight held double 2g is more than enough i used two strands of fingering weight held together for the sample it was knitted in woolyknit 4ply in the rose mix colourway with an oddment of west yorkshire spinners colour lab dk in arctic white for the contrast materials yarn 25g of dk weight yarn or fingering weight held double with a small scrap for the colourwork cc 3 5mm circular needles 60cm or longer for magic loop 4mm circular needles 60cm or longer for magic loop this pattern is free for personal use only ©wayward leaf designs 2025 gauge 22 stitches and 28 row over 4 inches notes mc main colour cc contrast colour m1 make 1 stitch by inserting the right needle tip under the bar between stitches and knitting through the back loop pattern with smaller needles cast on 56 stitches using the long-tail method or a stretchy cast-on of your choice round 1-10 k2 p2 to end round 11 k14 m1 4 times total you will now have 60 stitches change to 4mm needle round 12-14 knit round 15 k1 in mc k1 in cc to end of round round 16 knit in mc only round 17 k1 in cc k1 in mc to end of round round 18 knit in mc only rounds 19-22 repeat rounds 15-18 continue knitting in mc only until the cosy measures approx 6 5 inches from the cast-on edge or you are happy with the length next round place 30 stitches on each needle and graft the bottom of the tube together if you prefer you can turn it inside out and use the three-needle cast-off method this pattern is free for personal use only ©wayward
